etymology.description: 纯素(plain/vegan; purely plant-based) + 食者(eater/person) = vegan.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to a person who follows an entirely plant-based diet and avoids all animal-derived products. Highlights both the diet (纯素) and the identity of the person (食者).
etymology.simplification: 纯 was simplified from 純 by changing the silk radical 糸 to 纟 to reduce strokes; 素, 食, 者 are unchanged.

parts.english: to eat; food; meal; to feed

examples.chinese: 她是严格的纯素食者(她是嚴格的純素食者)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yángé de chúnsù shízhě.

examples.chinese: 纯素食者不吃任何动物性产品(純素食者不吃任何動物性產品)。
examples.pinyin: Chúnsù shízhě bù chī rènhé dòngwùxìng chǎnpǐn.
examples.english: Vegans do not eat any animal-based products.

examples.chinese: 餐厅提供纯素食者友好的菜单(餐廳提供純素食者友好的菜單)。
examples.pinyin: Cāntīng tígōng chúnsù shízhě yǒuhǎo de càidān.
examples.english: The restaurant offers a vegan-friendly menu.
